topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack 2.0: Installation for Helion Entry-scale Cloud with DCN / Nuage

section.p: This page describes the installation steps that are required for the HPE Helion OpenStack Entry-scale cloud models that utilize DCN 3.2R4. We explain how to deploy VRS and nuage Neutron plugins during the HPE Helion OpenStack 2.0 deployment.

section.title: Configure Your Environment
section.p: During the configuration phase of the installation you will be making modifications to the example configuration input files to match your cloud environment. You should use the Example Configurations documentation for detailed information on how to do this.
In the steps below we show how to set up the directory structure with the example input files as well as use the optional encryption methods for your sensitive data.

ol.li:
Copy the DCN tarball to the lifecycle manager and uncompress it: cd ~ && tar -xzvf dcn-hlm-20151105T225620Z.tgz
This archive contains all of the Ansible playbooks used to deploy the VRS and neutron-plugins.

Copy the VRS and Neutron-Plugin tarballs to the lifecycle manager: scp dcn-vrs-20151105T225620Z.tgz stack@<IP_OF_DEPLOYER>:/opt/hlm_packager/ scp dcn-plugin-20151105T225620Z.tgz stack@<IP_OF_DEPLOYER>:/opt/hlm_packager/
These two archives contain the packaged Neutron plugins as well as the VRS packages, including all of the dependencies that are needed.
Copy the example configuration files for the DCN model into your definition directory with this command: cp -r ~/helion/my_cloud/examples/dcn/* ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/

Edit the ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/data/servers.yml file to add the VSC and VSD configuration variables: --- product: version: 2
pass-through: global:
# DCN Plugin Configuration # dcn_vsd_hostname: vsd_host dcn_vsd_user: foo dcn_vsd_passwd: bar dcn_vsd_auth_resource: /foobar dcn_vsd_organization: foobar # (BoolOpt) Boolean for SSL connection with VSD server dcn_vsd_serverssl: True # (StrOpt) Nuage provided base uri to reach out to VSD dcn_vsd_base_uri: /nuage/api/v3_2
# DCN VRS Configuration # dcn_vsc_active_ip: 10.0.5.1 dcn_vsc_passive_ip: 10.0.5.2 dcn_vrs_nic: eth0 dcn_vrs_bridge: alubr0
servers:
- id: computeX ip-addr: 10.0.0.10 role: COMPUTE-DCN-ROLE ....
Ensure that all of the role values for each of your Compute nodes are changed from COMPUTE-ROLE to COMPUTE-DCN-ROLE like you see in the example above.

Edit the ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/data/server_roles.yml and add the definition for the COMPUTE-DCN-ROLE.
Example: --- product: version: 2
server-roles: - name: COMPUTE-DCN-ROLE interface-model: COMPUTE-INTERFACES disk-model: COMPUTE-DISKS
Edit the ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/data/control_plane.yml file and add the line below to specify the DCN component: - dcn-plugin

Also in the ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/data/control_plane.yml file, add a new section for the ROLE-DCN-COMPUTE role:
- name: dcn-compute resource-prefix: dcn-comp server-role: ROLE-DCN-COMPUTE min-count: 1 allocation-policy: any service-components: - ntp-client - nova-kvm - nova-compute-kvm - nova-compute - dcn-vrs
Enable the deployment of DCN with the following command: echo '-include: dcn-deploy.yml' >> ~/helion/hos/ansible/hlm-deploy.yml
Commit your configuration to the local git repo, as follows: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible git add -A git commit -m "My config or other commit message"
